isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - Meritor Transfer Cases MTC-4208, -4210, and -4213 - Removal

warning.para: To prevent serious eye injury, always wear safe eye protection when you perform vehicle maintenance or service.

Park the vehicle on a level surface. Block the wheels to prevent the vehicle from moving. Support the vehicle with safety stands. Do not work under a vehicle supported only by jacks. Jacks can slip and fall over. Serious personal injury can result.

step1.para: Park the vehicle on a level surface. Place blocks under the wheels not being raised to keep the vehicle from moving.
Raise the vehicle so that the area to be serviced is off the ground. Support the vehicle with safety stands.
Put a large container under the transfer case.
Remove the magnetic drain plug from the bottom of the transfer case. Drain and discard the oil correctly. Clean the magnetic drain plug (Figure 13).
Disconnect the drivelines from the input and output yokes or flanges of the transfer case.
Disconnect the air lines at the shift cylinders of the transfer case.
Disconnect the harness for the indicator switch wires.
Use a hydraulic roller jack to support the transfer case. Remove the mounting bolts that hold the transfer case to the vehicle.
Carefully remove the transfer case with the hydraulic jack.

caution.para: Close or cover all openings, including the breather, oil drain and speed sensor, before steam cleaning the outside of the transfer case. Steam can damage components.

step1.para: Close or cover all openings before steam cleaning. These openings include the breather, oil drain and speed sensor.
Steam clean the outside of the transfer case to remove heavy amounts of dirt.
Construct angle iron brackets or similar fixtures. Attach the brackets to the front half of the transfer case by installing bolts through the mounting holes in the transfer case (Figure 14).

note.para: Eye-bolts permit easier lifting of the transfer case.

step1.para: Install eye-bolts in the lifting holes located in either half of the transfer case housing. Lifting holes are located at the top and bottom of each half of the transfer case near the center (Figure 15).

warning.para: Support the transfer case with a lifting strap before mounting the transfer case into the repair stand. A transfer case that is not supported correctly can fall. Serious personal injury and damage to components can result.

note.para: The transfer case weighs approximately 670 lbs (304.2 kg) without the PTO.

step1.para: Attach a suitable lifting device to the eye-bolts to lift the transfer case. Use the angle iron brackets to mount the case in the repair stand (Figure 14).
